Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
grouch \grouch\ (grouch), n. A bad-tempered person.
Syn: grump, crank, churl, crosspatch. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
grouch \grouch\ v. i. to complain habitually, especially about minor or routine annoyances.
Syn: grumble, gripe. [WordNet 1.5]

grouch n : a bad-tempered person [syn: {grump}, {crank}, {churl}, {crosspatch}] v : show one's unhappiness or critical attitude; "He scolded about anything that he thought was wrong"; "We grumbled about the increased work load" [syn: {grumble}, {scold}]
